cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.CV. 

The paper deals with recommender systems, which are commonly studied in the machine learning community. The use of deep learning models, specifically recurrent autoencoders, suggests that the paper may belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. The paper also deals with content-based recommendation, which is a subfield of information retrieval (cs.IR). Additionally, the paper mentions the use of bag-of-words representation, which is commonly used in natural language processing (cs.CL). The paper also deals with collaborative filtering, which is a subfield of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper mentions the use of real-world datasets, which suggests that it may also belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category.
